trans-unit.source: Enterprise-class WordPress on Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Enterprise-class WordPress on Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to host an enterprise-class WordPress site on Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Learn how to host an enterprise-class WordPress site on Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Enterprise-class WordPress on Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Enterprise-class WordPress on Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Azure App Service provides a scalable, secure and easy to use environment for mission critical, large scale [WordPress][wordpress] sites.
trans-unit.target: Azure App Service provides a scalable, secure and easy to use environment for mission critical, large scale [WordPress][wordpress] sites.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft itself runs enterprise-class sites such as the [Office][officeblog] and [Bing][bingblog] blogs.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft itself runs enterprise-class sites such as the [Office][officeblog] and [Bing][bingblog] blogs.

trans-unit.source: This document shows you how you can use Azure App Service Web Apps to establish and maintain an enterprise-class, cloud-based WordPress site that can handle a large volume of visitors.
trans-unit.target: This document shows you how you can use Azure App Service Web Apps to establish and maintain an enterprise-class, cloud-based WordPress site that can handle a large volume of visitors.

trans-unit.source: Architecture and planning
trans-unit.target: Architecture and planning

trans-unit.source: A basic WordPress installation has only two requirements.
trans-unit.target: A basic WordPress installation has only two requirements.

trans-unit.source: **MySQL Database** - available through [ClearDB in the Azure Marketplace][cdbnstore], or you can manage your own MySQL installation on Azure Virtual Machines using either [Windows][mysqlwindows] or [Linux][mysqllinux].
trans-unit.target: **MySQL Database** - available through [ClearDB in the Azure Marketplace][cdbnstore], or you can manage your own MySQL installation on Azure Virtual Machines using either [Windows][mysqlwindows] or [Linux][mysqllinux].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] ClearDB provides several MySQL configurations, with different performance characteristics for each configuration.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] ClearDB provides several MySQL configurations, with different performance characteristics for each configuration.

trans-unit.source: See the [Azure Store][cdbnstore] for information on offerings provided through the Azure store or [ClearDB pricing](http://www.cleardb.com/pricing.view) for offerings directly from ClearDB.
trans-unit.target: See the [Azure Store][cdbnstore] for information on offerings provided through the Azure store or [ClearDB pricing](http://www.cleardb.com/pricing.view) for offerings directly from ClearDB.

trans-unit.source: **PHP 5.2.4 or greater** - Azure App Service currently provide [PHP versions 5.3, 5.4, and 5.5][phpwebsite].
trans-unit.target: **PHP 5.2.4 or greater** - Azure App Service currently provide [PHP versions 5.3, 5.4, and 5.5][phpwebsite].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] We recommend always running on the latest version of PHP to ensure you have the latest security fixes.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] We recommend always running on the latest version of PHP to ensure you have the latest security fixes.

trans-unit.source: Basic deployment
trans-unit.target: Basic deployment

trans-unit.source: Using just the basic requirements, you could create a basic solution within an Azure region.
trans-unit.target: Using just the basic requirements, you could create a basic solution within an Azure region.

trans-unit.source: an Azure web app and MySQL Database hosted in a single Azure region
trans-unit.target: an Azure web app and MySQL Database hosted in a single Azure region

trans-unit.source: While this would allow you to scale out your application by creating multiple Web Apps instances of the site, everything is hosted within the data centers in a specific geographic region.
trans-unit.target: While this would allow you to scale out your application by creating multiple Web Apps instances of the site, everything is hosted within the data centers in a specific geographic region.

trans-unit.source: Visitors from outside this region may see slow response times when using the site, and if the data centers in this region go down, so does your application.
trans-unit.target: Visitors from outside this region may see slow response times when using the site, and if the data centers in this region go down, so does your application.

trans-unit.source: Multi-region deployment
trans-unit.target: Multi-region deployment

trans-unit.source: Using Azure [Traffic Manager][trafficmanager], it's possible to scale your WordPress site across multiple geographic regions while providing only one URL for visitors.
trans-unit.target: Using Azure [Traffic Manager][trafficmanager], it's possible to scale your WordPress site across multiple geographic regions while providing only one URL for visitors.

trans-unit.source: All visitors come in through Traffic Manager and are then routed to a region based on the load balancing configuration.
trans-unit.target: All visitors come in through Traffic Manager and are then routed to a region based on the load balancing configuration.

trans-unit.source: an Azure web app, hosted in multiple regions, using CDBR High Availability router to route to MySQL across regions
trans-unit.target: an Azure web app, hosted in multiple regions, using CDBR High Availability router to route to MySQL across regions

trans-unit.source: Within each region, the WordPress site would still be scaled across multiple Web Apps instances, but this scaling is region specific; high traffic regions can be scaled differently than low traffic ones.
trans-unit.target: Within each region, the WordPress site would still be scaled across multiple Web Apps instances, but this scaling is region specific; high traffic regions can be scaled differently than low traffic ones.

trans-unit.source: Replication and routing to multiple MySQL Databases can be done using ClearDB's [CDBR High Availability Router][cleardbscale] (shown left,) or [MySQL Cluster CGE][cge].
trans-unit.target: Replication and routing to multiple MySQL Databases can be done using ClearDB's [CDBR High Availability Router][cleardbscale] (shown left,) or [MySQL Cluster CGE][cge].

trans-unit.source: Multi-region deployment with media storage and caching
trans-unit.target: Multi-region deployment with media storage and caching

trans-unit.source: If the site will accept uploads, or host media files, use Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: If the site will accept uploads, or host media files, use Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: If you need caching, consider [Redis cache][rediscache], [Memcache Cloud](http://azure.microsoft.com/gallery/store/garantiadata/memcached/), [MemCachier](http://azure.microsoft.com/gallery/store/memcachier/memcachier/), or one of the other caching offerings in the [Azure Store](http://azure.microsoft.com/gallery/store/).
trans-unit.target: If you need caching, consider [Redis cache][rediscache], [Memcache Cloud](http://azure.microsoft.com/gallery/store/garantiadata/memcached/), [MemCachier](http://azure.microsoft.com/gallery/store/memcachier/memcachier/), or one of the other caching offerings in the [Azure Store](http://azure.microsoft.com/gallery/store/).

trans-unit.source: an Azure web app, hosted in multiple regions, using CDBR High Availability router for MySQL, with Managed Cache, Blob storage, and CDN
trans-unit.target: an Azure web app, hosted in multiple regions, using CDBR High Availability router for MySQL, with Managed Cache, Blob storage, and CDN

trans-unit.source: Blob storage is geo-distributed across regions by default, so you don't have to worry about replicating files across all sites.
trans-unit.target: Blob storage is geo-distributed across regions by default, so you don't have to worry about replicating files across all sites.

trans-unit.source: You can be also enable the Azure [Content Distribution Network (CDN)][cdn] for Blob storage, which distributes files to end nodes closer to your visitors.
trans-unit.target: You can be also enable the Azure [Content Distribution Network (CDN)][cdn] for Blob storage, which distributes files to end nodes closer to your visitors.

trans-unit.source: Performance
trans-unit.target: Performance

trans-unit.source: Performance in the cloud is achieved primarily through caching and scale out; however the memory, bandwidth, and other attributes of Web Apps hosting should also be taken into consideration.
trans-unit.target: Performance in the cloud is achieved primarily through caching and scale out; however the memory, bandwidth, and other attributes of Web Apps hosting should also be taken into consideration.

trans-unit.target: Cache resources

trans-unit.source: [Redis cache][rediscache], [Memcache Cloud](/gallery/store/garantiadata/memcached/), [MemCachier](/gallery/store/memcachier/memcachier/), or one of the other caching offerings in the [Azure Store](/gallery/store/)
trans-unit.target: [Redis cache][rediscache], [Memcache Cloud](/gallery/store/garantiadata/memcached/), [MemCachier](/gallery/store/memcachier/memcachier/), or one of the other caching offerings in the [Azure Store](/gallery/store/)

trans-unit.target: Scale your application

trans-unit.source: [Scale a web app in Azure App Service][websitescale] and [ClearDB High Availability Routing][cleardbscale].
trans-unit.target: [Scale a web app in Azure App Service][websitescale] and [ClearDB High Availability Routing][cleardbscale].

trans-unit.source: If you choose to host and manage your own MySQL installation, you should consider [MySQL Cluster CGE][cge] for scale out
trans-unit.target: If you choose to host and manage your own MySQL installation, you should consider [MySQL Cluster CGE][cge] for scale out

trans-unit.source: Migration
trans-unit.target: Migration

trans-unit.source: There are two methods of migrating an existing WordPress site to Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: There are two methods of migrating an existing WordPress site to Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: **[WordPress export][export]** - This exports the content of your blog, which can then be imported to a new WordPress site on Azure App Service using the [WordPress importer plugin][import].
trans-unit.target: **[WordPress export][export]** - This exports the content of your blog, which can then be imported to a new WordPress site on Azure App Service using the [WordPress importer plugin][import].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] While this process allows you to migrate your content, it does not migrate any plugins, themes or other customizations.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] While this process allows you to migrate your content, it does not migrate any plugins, themes or other customizations.

trans-unit.source: These must be installed again manually.
trans-unit.target: These must be installed again manually.

trans-unit.source: **Manual migration** - [Back up your site][wordpressbackup] and [database][wordpressdbbackup], then manually restore it to a web app in Azure App Service and associated MySQL database to migrate highly customized sites and avoid the tedium of manually installing plugins, themes, and other customizations.
trans-unit.target: **Manual migration** - [Back up your site][wordpressbackup] and [database][wordpressdbbackup], then manually restore it to a web app in Azure App Service and associated MySQL database to migrate highly customized sites and avoid the tedium of manually installing plugins, themes, and other customizations.

trans-unit.source: Step-by-step instructions
trans-unit.target: Step-by-step instructions

trans-unit.source: Create a new WordPress site
trans-unit.target: Create a new WordPress site

trans-unit.source: Use the [Azure Marketplace][cdbnstore] to create a MySQL database of the size you identified in the [Architecture and planning](#planning) section, in the region(s) that you will host your site.
trans-unit.target: Use the [Azure Marketplace][cdbnstore] to create a MySQL database of the size you identified in the [Architecture and planning](#planning) section, in the region(s) that you will host your site.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps in [Create a WordPress web app in Azure App Service][createwordpress] to create a new WordPress web app.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps in [Create a WordPress web app in Azure App Service][createwordpress] to create a new WordPress web app.

trans-unit.source: When creating the web app, select **Use an existing MySQL Database** and select the database created in step 1.
trans-unit.target: When creating the web app, select **Use an existing MySQL Database** and select the database created in step 1.

trans-unit.source: If you are migrating an existing WordPress site, see [Migrate an existing WordPress site to Azure](#Migrate-an-existing-WordPress-site-to-Azure) after creating a new web app.
trans-unit.target: If you are migrating an existing WordPress site, see [Migrate an existing WordPress site to Azure](#Migrate-an-existing-WordPress-site-to-Azure) after creating a new web app.

trans-unit.source: Migrate an existing WordPress site to Azure
trans-unit.target: Migrate an existing WordPress site to Azure

trans-unit.source: As mentioned in the [Architecture and planning](#planning) section, there are two ways to migrate a WordPress site.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned in the [Architecture and planning](#planning) section, there are two ways to migrate a WordPress site.

trans-unit.source: **export and import** - for sites without a lot of customization, or where you just want to move the content.
trans-unit.target: **export and import** - for sites without a lot of customization, or where you just want to move the content.

trans-unit.source: **backup and restore** - for sites with a lot of customization where you want to move everything.
trans-unit.target: **backup and restore** - for sites with a lot of customization where you want to move everything.

trans-unit.source: Use one of the following sections to migrate your site.
trans-unit.target: Use one of the following sections to migrate your site.

trans-unit.source: The export and import method
trans-unit.target: The export and import method

trans-unit.source: Use [WordPress export][export] to export your existing site.
trans-unit.target: Use [WordPress export][export] to export your existing site.

trans-unit.source: Create a new web app using the steps in the [Create a new WordPress site](#Create-a-new-WordPress-site) section.
trans-unit.target: Create a new web app using the steps in the [Create a new WordPress site](#Create-a-new-WordPress-site) section.

trans-unit.source: Login to your WordPress site on Web Apps and click on **Plugins** -> **Add New**.
trans-unit.target: Login to your WordPress site on Web Apps and click on **Plugins** -> **Add New**.

trans-unit.source: Search for, and install, the **WordPress Importer** plugin.
trans-unit.target: Search for, and install, the **WordPress Importer** plugin.

trans-unit.source: After the importer plugin has been installed, click on **Tools** -> **Import**, and then select **WordPress** to use the WordPress importer plugin.
trans-unit.target: After the importer plugin has been installed, click on **Tools** -> **Import**, and then select **WordPress** to use the WordPress importer plugin.

trans-unit.source: On the **Import WordPress** page, click **Choose File**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Import WordPress** page, click **Choose File**.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the WXR file exported from your existing WordPress site, and then choose **Upload file and import**.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the WXR file exported from your existing WordPress site, and then choose **Upload file and import**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Submit**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Submit**.

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted that the import was successful.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted that the import was successful.

trans-unit.source: Once you have completed all these steps, restart your site from its web app blade in the [Azure preview portal][mgmtportal].
trans-unit.target: Once you have completed all these steps, restart your site from its web app blade in the [Azure preview portal][mgmtportal].

trans-unit.source: After importing the site, you may need to perform the following steps to enable settings not contained in the import file.
trans-unit.target: After importing the site, you may need to perform the following steps to enable settings not contained in the import file.

trans-unit.source: If you were using this...
trans-unit.target: If you were using this...

trans-unit.source: Do this...
trans-unit.target: Do this...

trans-unit.source: Permalinks
trans-unit.target: Permalinks

trans-unit.source: From the WordPress dashboard of the new site, click **Settings** -> **Permalinks** and then update the Permalinks structure
trans-unit.target: From the WordPress dashboard of the new site, click **Settings** -> **Permalinks** and then update the Permalinks structure

trans-unit.source: image/media links
trans-unit.target: image/media links

trans-unit.source: To update links to the new location, use the [Velvet Blues Update URLs plugin][velvet], a search and replace tool, or manually in your database
trans-unit.target: To update links to the new location, use the [Velvet Blues Update URLs plugin][velvet], a search and replace tool, or manually in your database

trans-unit.source: Themes
trans-unit.target: Themes

trans-unit.source: Go to **Appearance** -> **Theme** and update the site theme as needed
trans-unit.target: Go to **Appearance** -> **Theme** and update the site theme as needed

trans-unit.source: Menus
trans-unit.target: Menus

trans-unit.source: If your theme supports menus, links to your home page may still have the old sub-directory embedded in them.
trans-unit.target: If your theme supports menus, links to your home page may still have the old sub-directory embedded in them.

trans-unit.source: Go to **Appearance** -> **Menus** and update them
trans-unit.target: Go to **Appearance** -> **Menus** and update them

trans-unit.source: The backup and restore method
trans-unit.target: The backup and restore method

trans-unit.source: Back up your existing WordPress site using the information at [WordPress backups][wordpressbackup].
trans-unit.target: Back up your existing WordPress site using the information at [WordPress backups][wordpressbackup].

trans-unit.source: Back up your existing database using the information at [Backing up your database][wordpressdbbackup].
trans-unit.target: Back up your existing database using the information at [Backing up your database][wordpressdbbackup].

trans-unit.source: Create a new database and restore the backup.
trans-unit.target: Create a new database and restore the backup.

trans-unit.source: Purchase a new database from the [Azure Marketplace][cdbnstore], or setup a MySQL database on a [Windows][mysqlwindows] or [Linux][mysqllinux] VM.
trans-unit.target: Purchase a new database from the [Azure Marketplace][cdbnstore], or setup a MySQL database on a [Windows][mysqlwindows] or [Linux][mysqllinux] VM.

trans-unit.source: Using a MySQL client like [MySQL Workbench][workbench], connect to the new database and import your WordPress database.
trans-unit.target: Using a MySQL client like [MySQL Workbench][workbench], connect to the new database and import your WordPress database.

trans-unit.source: Update the database to change the domain entries to your new Azure App Service domain.
trans-unit.target: Update the database to change the domain entries to your new Azure App Service domain.

trans-unit.source: For example, mywordpress.azurewebsites.net.
trans-unit.target: For example, mywordpress.azurewebsites.net.

trans-unit.source: Use the [Search and Replace for WordPress Databases Script][searchandreplace] to safely change all instances.
trans-unit.target: Use the [Search and Replace for WordPress Databases Script][searchandreplace] to safely change all instances.

trans-unit.source: Create a new web app in the Azure Portal and publish the WordPress backup.
trans-unit.target: Create a new web app in the Azure Portal and publish the WordPress backup.

trans-unit.source: Create a new web app in the [Azure preview portal][mgmtportal] with a database using **New** -> **Web + Mobile** -> **Azure Marketplace** -> **Web Apps** -> **Web app + SQL** (or **Web app + MySQL**) -> **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Create a new web app in the [Azure preview portal][mgmtportal] with a database using **New** -> **Web + Mobile** -> **Azure Marketplace** -> **Web Apps** -> **Web app + SQL** (or **Web app + MySQL**) -> **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Configure all the required settings to create an empty web app.
trans-unit.target: Configure all the required settings to create an empty web app.

trans-unit.source: In your WordPress backup, locate the **wp-config.php** file and open it in an editor.
trans-unit.target: In your WordPress backup, locate the **wp-config.php** file and open it in an editor.

trans-unit.source: Replace the following entries with the information for your new MySQL database.
trans-unit.target: Replace the following entries with the information for your new MySQL database.

trans-unit.source: **DB_NAME** - the user name of the database
trans-unit.target: **DB_NAME** - the user name of the database

trans-unit.source: **DB_USER** - the user name used to access the database
trans-unit.target: **DB_USER** - the user name used to access the database

trans-unit.source: **DB_PASSWORD** - the user password
trans-unit.target: **DB_PASSWORD** - the user password

trans-unit.source: After changing these entries, save and close the **wp-config.php** file.
trans-unit.target: After changing these entries, save and close the **wp-config.php** file.

trans-unit.source: Use the [Deploy a web app in Azure App Service][deploy] information to enable the deployment method you wish to use, and then deploy your WordPress backup to your web app in Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: Use the [Deploy a web app in Azure App Service][deploy] information to enable the deployment method you wish to use, and then deploy your WordPress backup to your web app in Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Once the WordPress site has been deployed, you should be able to access the new site (as an App Service web app) using the *.azurewebsite.net URL for the site.
trans-unit.target: Once the WordPress site has been deployed, you should be able to access the new site (as an App Service web app) using the *.azurewebsite.net URL for the site.

trans-unit.source: Configure your site
trans-unit.target: Configure your site

trans-unit.source: After the WordPress site has been created or migrated, use the following information to improve performance or enable additional functionality.
trans-unit.target: After the WordPress site has been created or migrated, use the following information to improve performance or enable additional functionality.

trans-unit.source: To do this...
trans-unit.target: To do this...

trans-unit.source: Use this...
trans-unit.target: Use this...

trans-unit.source: Set App Service plan mode, size, and enable scaling
trans-unit.target: Set App Service plan mode, size, and enable scaling

trans-unit.source: Scale a web app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Scale a web app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: **Enable persistent database connections**
trans-unit.target: **Enable persistent database connections**

trans-unit.source: By default, WordPress does not use persistent database connections, which may cause your connection to the database to become throttled after multiple connections.
trans-unit.target: By default, WordPress does not use persistent database connections, which may cause your connection to the database to become throttled after multiple connections.

trans-unit.source: Edit the wp-includes/wp-db.php file.
trans-unit.target: Edit the wp-includes/wp-db.php file.

trans-unit.source: Find the following line.
trans-unit.target: Find the following line.

trans-unit.source: Replace the previous line with the following.
trans-unit.target: Replace the previous line with the following.

trans-unit.source: Find the following line.
trans-unit.target: Find the following line.

trans-unit.source: Replace the above line with the following.
trans-unit.target: Replace the above line with the following.

trans-unit.source: Save the file wp-includes/wp-db.php file and redeploy the site.
trans-unit.target: Save the file wp-includes/wp-db.php file and redeploy the site.

trans-unit.source: These changes may be overwritten when WordPress is updated.
trans-unit.target: These changes may be overwritten when WordPress is updated.

trans-unit.source: WordPress defaults to automatic updates, which can be disabled by editing the wp-config.php file and adding define ( 'WP_AUTO_UPDATE_CORE', false );
trans-unit.target: WordPress defaults to automatic updates, which can be disabled by editing the wp-config.php file and adding define ( 'WP_AUTO_UPDATE_CORE', false );

trans-unit.source: Another way of addressing updates would be to use a WebJob that monitors the wp-db.php file and performs the above modifications each time the file is updated.
trans-unit.target: Another way of addressing updates would be to use a WebJob that monitors the wp-db.php file and performs the above modifications each time the file is updated.

trans-unit.source: See Introduction to WebJobs for more information.
trans-unit.target: See Introduction to WebJobs for more information.

trans-unit.source: Improve performance
trans-unit.target: Improve performance

trans-unit.source: Disable the ARR cookie - can improve performance when running WordPress on multiple Web Apps instances
trans-unit.target: Disable the ARR cookie - can improve performance when running WordPress on multiple Web Apps instances

trans-unit.source: Enable caching.
trans-unit.target: Enable caching.

trans-unit.source: Redis cache (preview) can be used with the Redis object cache WordPress plugin, or use one of the other caching offerings from the Azure Store
trans-unit.target: Redis cache (preview) can be used with the Redis object cache WordPress plugin, or use one of the other caching offerings from the Azure Store

trans-unit.source: How to make WordPress faster with Wincache - Wincache is enabled by default for Web Apps
trans-unit.target: How to make WordPress faster with Wincache - Wincache is enabled by default for Web Apps

trans-unit.source: Scale a web app in Azure App Service and use ClearDB High Availability Routing or MySQL Cluster CGE
trans-unit.target: Scale a web app in Azure App Service and use ClearDB High Availability Routing or MySQL Cluster CGE

trans-unit.source: Use blobs for storage
trans-unit.target: Use blobs for storage

trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: Learn how to Use the Content Distribution Network (CDN) to geo-distribute data stored in blobs.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to Use the Content Distribution Network (CDN) to geo-distribute data stored in blobs.

trans-unit.source: Install and configure the Azure Storage for WordPress plugin.
trans-unit.target: Install and configure the Azure Storage for WordPress plugin.

trans-unit.source: For detailed setup and configuration information for the plugin, see the user guide.
trans-unit.target: For detailed setup and configuration information for the plugin, see the user guide.

trans-unit.source: Enable email
trans-unit.target: Enable email

trans-unit.source: Enable SendGrid using the Azure Store
trans-unit.target: Enable SendGrid using the Azure Store

trans-unit.source: Install the SendGrid plugin for WordPress
trans-unit.target: Install the SendGrid plugin for WordPress

trans-unit.source: Configure a custom domain name
trans-unit.target: Configure a custom domain name
